website_summaries.verdict: This crisp citrus sparkling water is sure to need constant restocking.
pros: Fun name with an exotic appeal
cons: May be difficult for some to pronounce

customer_reviews.title: Ehh it’s ok.
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. I am just not a huge fan of these. They have too simple of a flavor for my taste and at the price point you have to remind yourself it’s essentially lightly seasoned seltzer water. Just not my thing but others I know love the stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Phillycheese

customer_reviews.title: Not healthy but taste great
customer_reviews.text: I don’t like natural flavors in ingredients list. But it’s tasty and 0 calories
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Pamplemousse
customer_reviews.text: I mean, c'mon! It may be ubiquitous, but there's a reason for that... Pamplemousse!
customer_reviews.author: C. Peterson

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: tastes great and feels like soda without any negative health effects! your dentist will love it!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: and the subtle all natural flavoring of this sparkling water is perfect.
customer_reviews.text: delicious, and the subtle all natural flavoring of this sparkling water is perfect.
customer_reviews.author: nurseemily

customer_reviews.title: Yummy and no calories!
customer_reviews.text: Yummy and no calories!? How the heck do you do that?
customer_reviews.author: La Gita

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Best bubbly water out there as I have tried them all
customer_reviews.author: dana demore

customer_reviews.title: I love the minimal additives to this brand
customer_reviews.text: I love the minimal additives to this brand, but prefer the mango and passionfruit. Grapefuit was fine, though, just didn't make me want to reach for another. A bit like Fresca.
customer_reviews.author: BoSox

customer_reviews.title: Tastes awful, and ridiculously overpriced.
customer_reviews.text: I thought these tasted terrible, I couldn't even finish one can. If you want a flavored sparkling water with 0 calories, 0 sodium, 0 sugar, and 0 sweeteners, try Polar. If you do like these, buy them at the store - they're 4.99 for the same number of cans Amazon is charging 14.99 for.
customer_reviews.author: Glencora

customer_reviews.title: Good except for natural flavoring
customer_reviews.text: My main concern is it has natural flavoring rather than real fruit squeeze like spindrift
customer_reviews.author: peaches72

customer_reviews.title: I'm not a fan of grapefruit, but this won my heart!
customer_reviews.text: And it also won over my tastebuds. I usually don't enjoy grapefruit because of the overwhelming bitterness, and I was afraid that I wouldn't enjoy this drink. I really actually liked it!
customer_reviews.author: L Solo

product_meta.title: La Croix Sparkling Water, Grapefruit, 12 Fl Oz (Pack of 12)
product_meta.description: LaCroix is the best selling domestic sparkling water brand in the USA. A true American favorite for over 30 years, LaCroix has the distinction of being the number one sparkling water brand sold in cans. 100% natural sparkling waters with a hint of all natural flavor essences derived from the named fruit.
